verses.verse: A Psalm <S%H4210><s%> or Song <S%H7892><s%> for the sabbath <S%H7676><s%> day. <S%H3117><s%> It is a good <S%H2896><s%> thing to give thanks <S%H3034><s%> unto the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> and to sing praises <S%H2167><s%> unto thy name, <S%H8034><s%> O most High: <S%H5945><s%>
To show forth <S%H5046><s%> thy lovingkindness <S%H2617><s%> in the morning, <S%H1242><s%> and thy faithfulness <S%H530><s%> every night, <S%H3915><s%>
Upon <S%H5921><s%> an instrument of ten strings, <S%H6218><s%> and upon <S%H5921><s%> the psaltery; <S%H5035><s%> upon the harp <S%H3658><s%> with <S%H5921><s%> a solemn sound. <S%H1902><s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> thou, LORD, <S%H3068><s%> hast made me glad <S%H8055><s%> through thy work: <S%H6467><s%> I will triumph <S%H7442><s%> in the works <S%H4639><s%> of thy hands. <S%H3027><s%>
O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> how <S%H4100><s%> great <S%H1431><s%> are thy works! <S%H4639><s%> and thy thoughts <S%H4284><s%> are very <S%H3966><s%> deep. <S%H6009><s%>
A brutish <S%H1198><s%> man <S%H376><s%> knoweth <S%H3045><s%> not; <S%H3808><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> doth a fool <S%H3684><s%> understand <S%H995><s%> <S%H853><s%> this. <S%H2063><s%>

When the wicked <S%H7563><s%> spring <S%H6524><s%> as <S%H3644><s%> the grass, <S%H6212><s%> and when all <S%H3605><s%> the workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity <S%H205><s%> do flourish; <S%H6692><s%> it is that they shall be destroyed <S%H8045><s%> forever: <S%H5703><s%> <S%H5704><s%>
But thou, <S%H859><s%> LORD, <S%H3068><s%> art most high <S%H4791><s%> forevermore. <S%H5769><s%>

For, <S%H3588><s%> lo, <S%H2009><s%> thine enemies, <S%H341><s%> O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> for, <S%H3588><s%> lo, <S%H2009><s%> thine enemies <S%H341><s%> shall perish; <S%H6><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity <S%H205><s%> shall be scattered. <S%H6504><s%>
But my horn <S%H7161><s%> shalt thou exalt <S%H7311><s%> like the horn of a unicorn: <S%H7214><s%> I shall be anointed <S%H1101><s%> with fresh <S%H7488><s%> oil. <S%H8081><s%>

Mine eye <S%H5869><s%> also shall see <S%H5027><s%> my desire on mine enemies, <S%H7790><s%> and mine ears <S%H241><s%> shall hear <S%H8085><s%> my desire of the wicked <S%H7489><s%> that rise up <S%H6965><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> me.
The righteous <S%H6662><s%> shall flourish <S%H6524><s%> like the palm tree: <S%H8558><s%> he shall grow <S%H7685><s%> like a cedar <S%H730><s%> in Lebanon. <S%H3844><s%>
Those that be planted <S%H8362><s%> in the house <S%H1004><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> shall flourish <S%H6524><s%> in the courts <S%H2691><s%> of our God. <S%H430><s%>
They shall still <S%H5750><s%> bring forth fruit <S%H5107><s%> in old age; <S%H7872><s%> they shall be <S%H1961><s%> fat <S%H1879><s%> and flourishing; <S%H7488><s%>
To show <S%H5046><s%> that <S%H3588><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> is upright: <S%H3477><s%> he is my rock, <S%H6697><s%> and there is no <S%H3808><s%> unrighteousness <S%H5766><s%> in him.
